SKILLS

Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word.  Excellent communication Skills Organisational Skills SPSS Data Entry
Researches
Autosuggestion as a mediator in weight management in female college students. Master's
Thesis. (M.Sc, 2014-15)
Sample: 82 female college students, convenient sampling method. The selection of the
82 participants were based on the Inclusion and Exclusion Criteria.
The participants selected were assessed for their anthropometric data and they also
completed WHO (Five) Well- Being Index.
Group A (Exercise Diet Autosuggestion) and Group B ( Exercise Diet ).
Results: A marginal but not a statistically significant difference in the body weight of
the participants in both Group A and Group B. There was a statistically significant
difference in the well-being of the participants in both Group A and Group B.
Mindfulness and Burnout of Teachers in StateBoard and Matriculation schools
(Demographic factors).
Master's Project. (M.Sc, 2014)
Sample: 150 (51 Female and 24 Male in State board)(58 Female and 17 Male in
matriculation)
Scales : Mindfulness Attention Awareness scale and Burnout Inventory.
The data were analysed by standard statistical tools such as karl pearson co- efficient of
correlation, analysis of variance and t-test.
Result: There were no statistically significant relationship between Mindfulness and
Burnout in both Matriculation and State board schools.
Relation between Indian Zodiac and Personality types(MBTI).
Master's Project. (M.Sc,
2015)
Sample: 100 samples (Female 52 & Male 48) , were randomly selected.
The Myers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) was administered and scored.
The results showed that there was no significant relation between the two variables.
The
sample size cannot determine the relationship, further studies can be done to conclude or
disprove the findings of the current study.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Talent Development Sr. Consultant

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
You have a clear vision of where your career can go. And we have the leadership to help you get there. At CNA, we strive to create a culture in which people know they matter and are part of something important, ensuring the abilities of all employees are used to their fullest potential.

CNA seeks to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to our employees that helps them — and their family members — achieve their physical, financial, emotional and social wellbeing goals.

For a detailed look at CNA’s benefits, check out our Candidate Guide.

The Talent Development Senior Consultant works with Talent Development Leaders and HR Business Partners to deliver talent and learning solutions to improve business results. Successful candidates will be passionate about creating a learning culture, fostering inclusion and equity, and strategically growing the capacity and capability of talent.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Collaborates with Talent Development leaders and HR business partners to design and curate learning programs and pathways with creative, engaging and effective technologies that maximize the learner experience. Researches and identifies modern learning tools, methods, modalities and distribution methods. Recommends opportunities to apply new technologies to modernize and standardize the learner experience across the CNA talent development ecosystem. Manages the design, development and deployment of talent and learning content including program delivery and facilitation. Uses strong project management practices to set strategy and budget for multi-work stream projects; plans, develops and implements learning solutions; keeps stakeholders engaged and informedResearches and establishes relationships with relevant external vendors, partnering to customize contentDesigns and implements proactive communication and change management plans to ensure initiatives are well executedWorks closely with HR Shared Services to evaluate learning outcomes, participant satisfaction and business outcomes, and recommends continuous improvement methods. Proactively engages in external research and knowledge sharing to stay current on talent and leadership development trends and best practices and acts as an instructional design expert to key stakeholders. 


Skills, Knowledge And Abilities

Strong knowledge of learner experience design, instructional design methods, adult learning and modern blended learning theory and strategies. Expertise and knowledge in contemporary leadership development trends is a plus. Strong knowledge of learning technologies, content creation and curation tools and learning modalities. This includes CNA’s Learning Management System and Microsoft Office Suite as well as learning technologies such as Articulate 360, Rise and Vyond. Solid business acumen, knowledge of business and client groups, and ability to effectively conduct needs analysis and implement talent and learning strategies to support business goals. Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. Ability to facilitate large groups through the use of group dynamics while encouraging creativity and innovation and achievement of learning outcomes. Excellent project management, organizing and planning skills and ability to manage multiple and shifting priorities in a fast paced and challenging environment. Highly collaborative and comfortable navigating organizational dynamics. Ability to exercise independent judgement and make critical business decisions effectively, at times with ambiguous or incomplete information


Reporting Relationship

AVP, Talent Development

Education And Experience

Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalentTypically, a minimum of eight years of strategic talent development experience. 


CNA is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the recruitment process. To request an accommodation, please contact leaveadministration@cna.com.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
